bill.title: Relating To Firearms.
bill.description: Requires firearm owners to report lost, stolen, or destroyed firearms. (HB720 HD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to PVM, JUD, referral sheet 5
Bill scheduled to be heard by PVM on Wednesday, 02-13-19 10:00AM in House conference room 430.

The committees on PVM recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Takayama, Gates, D. Kobayashi, Nishimoto, Ohno; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Kong, McDermott; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
Reported from PVM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 521) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) McDermott, Okimoto voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, DeCoite, Nakamura, Quinlan, Thielen excused (5).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-19-19 2:05PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-20-19.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 02-20-19 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) C. Lee, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Lowen, Takayama, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Morikawa; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Say; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) McKelvey, Yamane.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 888), recommending passage on Third Reading.

Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Okimoto, Quinlan, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Har, Kong, McDermott, Say voting no (4) and Representative(s) DeCoite excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 72).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDC.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-19 1:35PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Wakai, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Harimoto, Fevella.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1383) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDC.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDC.
The committee(s) on JDC will hold a public decision making on 03-28-19 9:45AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDC were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) K. Rhoads, Gabbard, Kim; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Wakai, Fevella.
Reported from JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1856) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
One Day Notice 04-05-19.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Fevella). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 661).
Transmitted to Governor.
